rComments: I would not ever take this profs class again. Completely unreachable even during the exam period, nowhere to submit exam and BrightSpace page closed before the exam was due; frequently disorganized; only got 1 grade back before the exam; cuts students off; and doesn't seem to know his own material, or just doesn't care to check facts/ sources.

He is very knowledgeable, and passionate about health, politics and public politics. Seminar discussions were engaging and interesting. But he is disorganized when it comes to providing grades, and is hard to reach by email. Don't expect him to give you any marks on previous assignments.

He is personable and very knowledgeable about public policy and gives clear and engaging lectures. However, his expectations were very unclear, and even contradictory regarding assignments and grading criteria, and does not give very helpful feedback. Forget about contacting him for clarification- he doesnt reply to his emails.
He doesn't really reply to emails. He's a very knowledgeable professor though. Tough grader and unclear with assignment instructions.

Knowledgable professor, good lecturer, and generally personable. Not very good at facilitating seminar discussions (asks very pointed questions, conversation becomes only between 5 poli sci/public admin students). Completely unreachable by email, literally just does not reply. Mostly dry readings. Inconsistent instructions for assignments.

Professor Fafard is incredibly understanding! If you communicate with him, he is always willing to give you a hand! I found myself needing an extension, which made me very anxious, but he was gracious. He is also an engaging lecturer and cares to see his students succeed. However, he means business. If you are a sub-par writer, good luck.
Fafard is a great lecturer, very knowledgable and passionate about politics and policy, but can come across as arrogant with some frequency.

Fafard is a WEALTH of knowledge. Was lucky to have him in 4th year. Very respected by the field and by students. The course is a great mixture between academia and discussion on current affairs, but with lots of public policy analysis on current affairs. The course load is in the mid-high range, but he gives amazing feedback on papers. Great prof!
